block.p: Christine Yukiko Adams, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles A. Adams of Singapore, was married on Friday to Michael Rurik Halaby, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Rurik B. Halaby of Ridgewood, N.J. The Rev. Joseph E. Griesedieck performed the ceremony at St. Thomas Episcopal Church in New York.

Mrs. Halaby, 33, is known as Tina. Until last spring she was a production manager at Polo Ralph Lauren in New York. She graduated from the University of California at Davis. The bride's father is the Asia-Pacific regional president of United Parcel Service, based in Singapore.

Christine Yukiko Adams, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles A. Adams of Singapore, was married on Friday to Michael Rurik Halaby, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Rurik B. Halaby of Ridgewood, N.J. The Rev. Joseph E. Griesedieck performed the ceremony at St. Thomas Episcopal Church in New York.

Mrs. Halaby, 33, is known as Tina. Until last spring she was a production manager at Polo Ralph Lauren in New York. She graduated from the University of California at Davis. The bride's father is the Asia-Pacific regional president of United Parcel Service, based in Singapore.
Mr. Halaby, also 33, is an investment banker in London for ABN AMRO Bank, where he helps companies issue bonds. He graduated from the University of Denver and received an M.B.A. from Columbia.
The bridegroom's mother, Cynthia Halaby, is a trustee of Valley Hospital in Ridgewood. His father is the chairman of the AgriCapital Corporation, a New York investment bank.
